result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd) .202. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) .202 was dismissed by the court.

  • Jane R. Evanoff was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jane R. Evanoff

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: granting travel outside of United States

8:42 a.m. Defendant Jane R. Evanoff in court with attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cm35, 16tr222, 16tr223, 16tr224. Sowinski recites agreeement. State moves to dismiss Counts 2 and 3, 16tr222, 16tr223, and 16tr224- Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Letter from Options Treatment Center filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Sowinski/Ferguson/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP- 2 years
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
Fine - $1,429 plus blood draw surcharge/IID surcharge
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Jail - 6 days with Huber for all purposes. To commence on/before Friday, June 10, 2016 at 4:00 p.m. May serve in Vilas County.
Jail credit - 1 day if revoked
Driver's license revocation - 14 months
IID - 12 months
Driver's Safety Plan
AODA Assessment
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Appeal rights given. Payment application plan given.
Adj. 9:01 a.m.  Review hearing scheduled for September 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on May 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

2:16 p.m. Attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cm35, 16tr224, 16tr223, 16tr222.   In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea 
Bail continued. Transfer to Branch 2. Adj. 2:17 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

2:21 p.m. MJB for PFO. Defendant Jane R. Evanoff in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 16cm35, 16tr222, 16tr223, 16tr224. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond. Adj. 2:23 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
